commit 2f1f1b22f0da5ad6676cb404fbb09544ac3b0ede
Author: Luke Klinker <lklinker1@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Oct 23 08:02:08 2016 -0500

    lets finally stop delaying things on the timelines
    
    It is plenty optimized now, delaying actions and creating/posting to handlers like that is hurting more than it helps. Especially since glide now manages the images instead of us doing that ourselves. The only thing that is a bit worse is that it will eagerly load quoted tweets a bit sooner, but this should be a change for the better, not worse

commit 4c2d5a4a3125f93fef07e6af13014b698adbf8d6
Author: lukeklinker <lklinker1@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 1 19:25:58 2014 -0600

    reworked the live streaming again. the problem is that there is a possibility to miss tweets if you come into the app and have live streaming on but it isn't at the top of the list, so it doesn't automatically refresh. That means that you could possibly be behind on the tweets, but the live streaming won't stop and it will insert that tweet when it comes in, placing it at the end of the database and then i will read it as the last tweet and all of the ones before will be missed...
    
    This should be gone now, because right after startup, i make calls to the api to refresh the timeline when the first new one from the streaming comes in. the user won't notice, but it should work to make sure all the tweets are put in correctly. the only thing is that that first one will take a few extra seconds to show up in the toast, but i don't care haha
    
    just had to write out all my thoughts before i forgot them haha

97	86	src/com/klinker/android/twitter/ui/fragments/HomeFragment.java
